item.description:
Please RSVP! Bring your spouses and loved ones to this meeting! Given Debra's talk and folksy approach to an industry that is central to personal wellness, we encourage you to share this talk, description and bio with your spouses or especial loved ones. Perhaps this meeting will be an ideal opportunity for your loved ones to participate in your investing life.

TITLE: INSIDER TAKE ON THE NATURAL PRODUCTS INDUSTRY by DEBRA STARK, Member of Boston IBD, Owner of Debra's Natural Gourmet in West Concord, MA, Founder and President of Stark Sisters Granola.

DESCRIPTION: Think Whole Foods is the only company in the natural product industry? Want to know how the nuts and berries crowd views the rest of the world? What drives the bottom line? Is it the food scare with contaminated products arriving from China? Mad cow disease? The diabetes epidemic? Is this industry growing because people just want to feel better and live longer? Debra will review several companies from supply side to retail within the industry. She will also bring some samples of products in the industry to taste.

BIO: DEBRA STARK is the owner of Debra's Natural Gourmet, a natural product store in West Concord, Massachusetts. She is also the founder and president of Stark Sisters Granola (1992). National television shows like "20/20" have showcased Debra's Natural Gourmet, rated one of the top 100 natural food stores in the country, and Debra has been featured in Cooking Light and Inc. Magazine, which called Debra's Natural Gourmet one of the five home-town powerhouse businesses. Her management style was showcased in Investor?s Business Daily.

Stark Sisters Granola manufactures award-winning, gourmet granolas praised by the likes of Bon Appetit, The New York Times, The Boston Globe and Chicago Tribune. Stark Sisters Granola started in the kitchen of Debra's Natural Gourmet, where Debra's customers so loved the granola she made that they insisted she keep stirring and finally take it to market! Stark Sisters Granola continues to have a fiercely loyal following spreading across the country, growing thanks to word of mouth. Her granolas can be found in bulk bins in stores like Whole Foods.

Debra writes a newsletter for more than 11,000 devoted readers in the greater Boston area together with her son, Adam. She has also written columns on health and nutrition for publications including newspaper, Boston Globe, website MotherNature.com, and consumer periodical Great Life Magazine. She is also the author of two cookbooks -- If Kallimos Had A Chef (VanderWyk & Burnham and Debra?s Natural Gourmet Cookbook, Eat Well Be Happy, A Second Bite (Lightning Source).

AGENDA

This meeting's agenda will have the following agenda:
7:00 - Meeting Begins:
- Technical Analysis update by Harlan
- Stockpicks
- Feature Presentation by DEBRA STARK (see above)

Our members value open discussion highly. We try to pack as much open discussion as possible. Expressing ideas and sharing knowledge is paramount to our members.
All levels of expertise are welcome. No question is too simple - as a matter of fact the simplest question often evokes the best discussion!

If you talk stocks with someone then bring them with you!

To join our online discussion go to
http://groups.google....
or send email to DouglasWRoberts@gmail.com.

Food or drinks are not allowed in any MIT meeting room.

This is a free and open meeting. There is no membership required, but please RSVP for yourself and any guests.
item.name: Boston Investor's Business Daily Tuesday Meetup
